wikipedia_page.main: William Peden Dunlop (11 August 1874 – 28 November 1941) was a Scottish footballer who played for Liverpool in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, earning two Football League championship medals. Dunlop played once for Scotland, in 1906.

response: * Billy Dunlop (footballer, born 1874) (1874–1941), Scottish international footballer who played for Liverpool
* Billy Dunlop (Sunderland footballer) (fl. 1893–1901), Scottish football half-back who played for Sunderland and Rangers in the 1890s
* Billy Dunlop (footballer, born 1926) (1926–1994), Scottish football inside forward who played for various clubs in the 1950s
